description.text: This is one of the Specialisations that can be chosen within the master's programme - meet your personal interests.

targetDescription.text: English is a member of the West Germanic group of the Germanic languages. It is an official language of almost 60 sovereign states and is now a global lingua franca.It is the third-most-common native language in the world and it is widely learned as a second language.

L’anglais est une langue appartenant au groupe occidental des langues germaniques. C’est la langue officielle de près de 60 États souverains. De nos jours, l’anglais est une lingua franca mondiale (langue véhiculaire).L’anglais est la troisième langue maternelle la plus parlée dans le monde et la langue la plus étudiée comme deuxième langue.

Irish, Irish Gaelic, or Gaelic (Gaeilge) belongs to the Gaelic branch of the Celtic family of languages, originating in Ireland and historically spoken by the Irish people.Irish is spoken as a first language by a small minority of Irish people, and as a second language by a rather larger group. Irish enjoys constitutional status as the national and first official language of the Republic of Ireland, and is an officially recognised minority language in Northern Ireland.

L’irlandais, gaélique irlandais ou gaélique (Gaeilge) appartient à la branche gaélique de la famille des langues celtiques, originaires de l’Irlande et historiquement parlées par le peuple irlandais.L’irlandais est utilisé comme première langue par une minorité irlandaise et comme deuxième langue par un groupe beaucoup plus large. L’irlandais bénéficie d’un statut constitutionnel comme langue officielle nationale et première langue de la République d’Irlande, et est une langue minoritaire officiellement reconnue en Irlande du Nord.

targetFrameworkName.text: Europass Standard List of Modes Of Learning and Assessment

targetDescription.text: Learning which takes place in an organised and structured environment, specifically dedicated to learning, and typically leads to the award of a qualification, usually in the form of a certificate or a diploma; it includes systems of general education, initial vocational training and higher education.

targetFrameworkName.text: Europass Standard List Of Learning Setting Types

targetDescription.text: <html:div xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" class="Knowledge">advanced knowledge of a field of work or study, involving a critical understanding of theories and principles</html:div> <html:div xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" class="Skill">advanced skills, demonstrating mastery and innovation, required to solve complex and unpredictable problems in a specialised field of work or study</html:div> <html:div xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" class="Competence">manage complex technical or professional activities or projects, taking responsibility for decisionmaking in unpredictable work or study contexts <html:br></html:br>take responsibility for managing professional development of individuals and groups </html:div>

description.text: Competence in recognising the most significant environmental impacts of products and processes and their importance in terms of business; you will be able to apply theories and the most recent scientific knowledge to solve problems involving environmental aspects.

description.text: Knowledge about technical possibilities of industrial, service, community, and primary production processes and systems to minimise environmental impacts; you will be able to explain the complex interdependencies of both local and global environmental problems and apply theories to find the most sustainable product or process design.

description.text: Skills to understand the requirements of systemic change and analyse how competitive in terms of environmental impacts and costs a certain technology, product or service is in different operating environments; you will be able to work as an environmental expert in a range of decision-making situations and produce and convey information to support stakeholders in environmental decision-making.

targetDescription.text: English is a member of the West Germanic group of the Germanic languages. It is an official language of almost 60 sovereign states and is now a global lingua franca.It is the third-most-common native language in the world and it is widely learned as a second language.

L’anglais est une langue appartenant au groupe occidental des langues germaniques. C’est la langue officielle de près de 60 États souverains. De nos jours, l’anglais est une lingua franca mondiale (langue véhiculaire).L’anglais est la troisième langue maternelle la plus parlée dans le monde et la langue la plus étudiée comme deuxième langue.

Irish, Irish Gaelic, or Gaelic (Gaeilge) belongs to the Gaelic branch of the Celtic family of languages, originating in Ireland and historically spoken by the Irish people.Irish is spoken as a first language by a small minority of Irish people, and as a second language by a rather larger group. Irish enjoys constitutional status as the national and first official language of the Republic of Ireland, and is an officially recognised minority language in Northern Ireland.

L’irlandais, gaélique irlandais ou gaélique (Gaeilge) appartient à la branche gaélique de la famille des langues celtiques, originaires de l’Irlande et historiquement parlées par le peuple irlandais.L’irlandais est utilisé comme première langue par une minorité irlandaise et comme deuxième langue par un groupe beaucoup plus large. L’irlandais bénéficie d’un statut constitutionnel comme langue officielle nationale et première langue de la République d’Irlande, et est une langue minoritaire officiellement reconnue en Irlande du Nord.

Scottish Gaelic, sometimes also called Gaelic, is a Celtic language native to Scotland.Gaelic is an official language in Scotland and it is a recognised minority language of the United Kingdom, protected under the European Charter for Regional or Minority Languages.

Le gaélique écossais ou écossais est une langue celtique parlée en Écosse.Le gaélique écossais est reconnu par le Royaume-Uni comme langue régionale de l’Écosse, selon la charte européenne des langues régionales ou minoritaires.

targetFrameworkName.text: Europass Standard List of Modes Of Learning and Assessment

description.text: Description: Bioeconomy Project

additionalNote.text: Attila Turos, Lead: Future of Production, World Economic Forum: “Circular economy is an economic system that is regenerative by design. … The linear economy is the prevailing model because simply the world is just not in tune or necessarily aware of the circular model and it’s economic and societal benefits.”
additionalNote.subject: More information

additionalNote.text: “It’s a big step because we are used to thinking linear – produce, sell, wear, stop, throw it away – and now we have to go take it back to our production countries, so that’s another way of thinking.”"
additionalNote.subject: Hendrik Stiksma, Former Commercial Director, Tricorp
